newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan adjusts rupee down against dollar.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan adjusts rupee down against dollar.

text.p: The State (central) Bank of Pakistan on Tuesday depreciated the rupee to 40.3300/40.5317 to the dollar from 40.2400/40.4412 fixed on April 23.
The central bank gave no reason for the change, but bankers said it was in line with a government policy to keep exports competitive.
Bankers said the dollar had strengthened against other major currencies in the past six months, while inflation in Pakistan was running close to 12 percent a year.
They said with a stubborn trade deficit and a strong dollar in international markets, the central bank had to reassess the value of the rupee to keep Pakistani exports competitive.
